items.title: Convergence in the WFR Metric
items.content:
2379: :label: conj-wfr-convergence
2380: 
2381: The composition of the kinetic evolution $\Psi_{\text{kin,adapt}}$ and the cloning selection $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ is a contraction in the Wasserstein-Fisher-Rao (WFR) metric. Consequently, the empirical distribution converges in WFR distance:
2382: 
2383: $$
2384: \text{WFR}(\mu_t, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le C_{\text{WFR}} e^{-\lambda_{\text{WFR}} t}
2385: 
2386: $$

items.raw_directive:

items.label: conj-lsi-companion-dependent-full
items.title: LSI for Companion-Dependent Geometric Gas
items.content:
4991: :label: conj-lsi-companion-dependent-full
4992: 
4993: We conjecture that under the assumptions of {prf:ref}`thm-main-complete-cinf-geometric-gas-full`, the Geometric Gas satisfies a **Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality** with constant $\alpha > 0$:
4994: 
4995: $$
4996: \text{Ent}_\mu(\rho) \leq \frac{1}{\alpha} \mathcal{E}(\rho, \rho)
4997: 
4998: $$
4999: 
5000: where:
5001: - $\text{Ent}_\mu(\rho) = \int \rho \log(\rho/\mu) d\mu$ (relative entropy)
5002: - $\mathcal{E}(\rho, \rho) = -\int \rho \mathcal{L}_{\text{geo}} \log \rho \, d\mu$ (Dirichlet form)

items.label: conj-ldp-mean-field
items.title: Large Deviations Principle for Mean-Field Limit (Unproven)
items.content:
216: :label: conj-ldp-mean-field
217: 
218: As $N \to \infty$, the empirical measure $\mu_N = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \delta_{(x_i, v_i)}$ is conjectured to satisfy a large deviations principle with rate function:
219: 
220: $$
221: I(\rho) = \begin{cases}
222: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) & \text{if } \rho \ll \rho_\infty \\
223: +\infty & \text{otherwise}
224: \end{cases}
225: 
226: $$
227: 
228: This means deviations from the mean-field limit $\rho_\infty$ would be exponentially suppressed with probability $\sim e^{-N \cdot D_{\text{KL}}}$.
229: 
230: **Status**: This LDP has **not been proven** for systems with state-dependent killing and proportional revival. Standard LDP results (Dawson-G채rtner, Dupuis-Ellis) apply to conservative systems or systems with fixed jump rates, not QSD-conditioned dynamics.
